channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The death toll from a crackdown on protests in Iran jumps to over 2,500, activists say
item.description: The number of dead climbed to at least 2,571 early Wednesday, as reported by the U.S.-based Human Rights Activists News Agency, as Iranians made phone...

item.title: Trump administration sends letter wiping out addiction, mental health grants
item.description: The Trump administration sent hundreds of letters Tuesday terminating federal grants supporting mental health and drug addiction services.

item.title: Saks Files for Bankruptcy as Department Stores Fight for Survival
item.description: The parent company of Saks, Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman struggled with debt, designers and customers in recent years.

item.title: Trump’s Threats to Greenland Raise Serious Questions for NATO
item.description: The treaty that created NATO did not contemplate an attack by one ally on another. A seizure of Greenland by President Trump would test the endurance ...

item.title: Mark Carney Heads to Beijing to Discuss Canada-China Relations as U.S. Outlook Darkens
item.description: The prime minister is seeking new markets for Canadian goods and to mend relations with China after years of deep acrimony between the two nations.

item.title: New analysis on U.S. economy. And, MN prosecutors quit over DOJ probe into Good widow
item.description: Trump pitches affordability on a national tour to combat voter frustration. And, Minnesota federal prosecutors resign after DOJ pressure to probe Rene...

item.title: Banks Ready Battle Plans to Save Their Credit Card Businesses
item.description: “Everything’s on the table,” an executive at JPMorgan Chase said, as the industry seeks to head off President Trump’s effort to cap interest rates.

item.title: The risks of AI in schools outweigh the benefits, report says
item.description: A new report warns that AI poses a serious threat to children's cognitive development and emotional well-being.

item.title: U.S. Moves Some Personnel From Key Air Base as Tensions Mount With Iran
item.description: Nonessential personnel are being removed from Udeid Air Base in Qatar, the main U.S. air operations hub in the region, as President Trump weighs a mil...

item.title: Greetings from Acre, Israel, where an old fortress recalls the time of the Crusades
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Why Greenland Matters for a Warming World
item.description: The fate of the world’s largest island has outsize importance for billions of people on the planet, because as the climate warms, Greenland is losing ...

item.title: ‘We’re Not Stupid’: What Greenlanders Would Say to Trump
item.description: A visit to Greenland reveals a swirl of feelings as people nervously await talks with the Trump administration about the island’s future.

item.title: Mark Carney Heads to Beijing to Discuss Canada-China Relations as U.S. Outlook Darkens
item.description: The prime minister is seeking new markets for Canadian goods and to mend relations with China after years of deep acrimony between the two nations.

item.title: U.K. Retreats on Plan to Require ‘BritCard’ ID for Workers
item.description: Workers will be able to use a variety of digital IDs to prove their right to work in Britain, the government said Wednesday, diluting a plan it announ...
